serverDriver

Class SelendroidServerDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • serverDriver.SelendroidServerDriver

  • public class SelendroidServerDriver
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of this class is to provide an interface with the Selendroid server itself. It is responsible for starting the Selendroid Server and extracting information from the application.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double defaultWaitTimeSeconds

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SelendroidServerDriver(java.lang.String apkPath, java.lang.String capabilities)
      Creates a SelendroidServerDriver instance with a specified application APK path and capabilities and launches a Selendroid server with those parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SelendroidServerDriver

        public SelendroidServerDriver(java.lang.String apkPath,
                              java.lang.String capabilities)
        Creates a SelendroidServerDriver instance with a specified application APK path and capabilities and launches a Selendroid server with those parameters. Launches the Selendroid server with the previously given launch parameters.
        Parameters:
        apkPath - - the path of the target APK
        capabilities - - the capabilities of the APK (see the help guide on "capabilities" for more information)

    • Method Detail

      • extractHierarchy

        public java.lang.String extractHierarchy()
        Extracts the current activity's hierarchy view. Note: remains unimplemented as in previous codebase; does not fit into priorities of user stories.
        Returns:
        the overall hierarchy of the application's current activity

      • extractPageSource

        public java.lang.String extractPageSource()
        Extracts the entire page source for the current page. The entire page source includes the WebView HTML and the widget hierarchy.
        Returns:
        page source as a string

      • extractWebViewHTML

        public java.lang.String extractWebViewHTML()
        Returns just the WebView HTML source.
        Returns:
        the HTML source of the WebView as a string

      • extractElements

        public java.lang.String extractElements()
        Extracts all interactive elements from the current WebView. These found elements are then added to an array of possible targets. All elements are found, but only the ones with attributes suggesting that they are interactive are kept.
        Returns:
        the list of elements as a formatted string

      • setPageAsVisited

        public void setPageAsVisited(java.lang.String HREF)
        Allows a tester to remove a hashed paged if it has been clicked, as well as add it to the list of clicked pages

      • getLinksClicked

        public int getLinksClicked()
        Returns the number of links clicked during the test

      • getLinksFound

        public int getLinksFound()
        Returns the number of links found during the test

      • extractElementNames

        public java.lang.String extractElementNames()
        Extracts the names of all elements in the WebView and returns them as a formatted XML string.
        Returns:
        names of elements found as an XML string

      • extractElementsByKeyword

        public java.lang.String extractElementsByKeyword(java.lang.String keyword)
        Extracts all elements whose names match the given keyword
        Parameters:
        keyword - - the keyword to match
        Returns:
        outputString - formatted output of found elements

      • getPagesVisited

        public int getPagesVisited()
        Returns the number of pages visited.
        Returns:
        number of pages visited, if any

      • getCoverage

        public float getCoverage()
        Returns the coverage of the test. Coverage percentage is represented as a floating point value equivalent to the equation (links clicked / links found)
        Returns:
        the coverage percentage of the test as a float

      • switchToWebView

        public void switchToWebView()
        Forces the driver to switch to the WebView context This is necessary if the driver was previously switched to the native view context as nothing can be extracted from the WebView if the WebView context isn't being used.

      • hardwareBack

        public void hardwareBack()
        Simulates pressing the hardware back button on an Android device for the purpose of going back to a previous activity while testing.

      • webviewBack

        public void webviewBack()
        Simulates pressing the WebView back button for the purpose of going back a page in the WebView history.

      • resumeApp

        public void resumeApp()
        Resumes the application from the foreground. You'll notice that this calls driver.backgroundApp() first. The reason for this is that in the context of our application, when you "leave" the app the app is still technically in the foreground in some cases, like when you're on the phone screen or texting screen. Nothing happens if you call backgroundApp() if its already in the background, so this calls it just in case.

      • hideApp

        public void hideApp()
        Hides the application by sending it to the background.

      • closeApp

        public void closeApp()
        Closes the application being tested.

      • end

        public void end()
        Tears down the Selendroid server. This method is useful for cleanup and necessary if different Selendroid capabilities must be selected.

      • putElementInView

        public void putElementInView(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement target)
        Scrolls the application window until the given target is in view.
        Parameters:
        target -

      • clickTargetJS

        public void clickTargetJS(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement target)
        Interacts with the given target by simulating a click in JavaScript. This is done to ensure that the target is always present in the list view.
        Parameters:
        target -
